intro: Tephrosia aequilata subsp. nyasae, commonly known as the African tephrosia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly in countries like Malawi, Tanzania, and Zambia. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and trifoliate leaves with small, rounded lobes. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in terminal clusters, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The species is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
